place.name: TREVALGA
place.gazetteerText: TREVALGA, a parish in Camelford district, Cornwall; on the coast, 5 miles NNW of Camelford, and 16½ W by N of Launceston r. station. Post town, Boscastle, Cornwall. Acres, 1,299. Real property, £1,197. Pop., 158. Houses, 30. The manor belongs to the Duke of Devonshire. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Exeter. Value, £146.* Patron, the Dean and Chapter of E. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
